Article.Abstract: The human CD4+ T-cell repertoire of responses to hemagglutinin (HA) of influenza virus A/Beijing/32/92 was examined 3 to 6 months after natural infection by using a panel of 16-mer peptides overlapping by 11 residues. Short-term CD4+ T-cell lines were derived by using full-length HAs of virus A/Beijing/32/92 from 12 unrelated, major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class I and II haplotyped adults with a history of influenza in November and December 1993 and from 6 adults with no history of influenza during the preceding 4 years but who responded to HA. In contrast to recent murine studies, the human CD4+ T-cell repertoire of responses was dominated by the recognition of highly conserved epitopes. The HA2 subunit, widely regarded as nonimmunogenic, induced strong responses in every donor. This resulted in functional cross-reactivity among influenza A viruses. Our study included one pair of unrelated donors expressing identical HLA DRB1 and DQB1 alleles and two pairs of donors sharing low-resolution MHC class II types. These pairs responded to identical peptides; furthermore, clearly identifiable patterns of response were seen in donors sharing single class II haplotypes, irrespective of the presence of other alleles and exposure history. Two conserved regions which induced responses in 17 of 18 donors were identified (residues 295 to 328 and 407 to 442). Possible implications for cross-reactive T-cell vaccines are discussed.
Article.ArticleTitle: Human CD4+ T-cell repertoire of responses to influenza A virus hemagglutinin after recent natural infection.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Biology, Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine, London, England.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The HA 1-35 epitopic region was mapped with a pool of five 16-mer peptides encompassing this region, but no further fine epitope mapping was done. The HA 1-35 sequence corresponds to amino acids 17-51 of Genbank ID 49339231 for HA of Influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92).

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Twelve donors had a history of recent (3-6 months) flu infection, and the other 6 had no history of influenza-like illness during the previous 4 years. However, natural infection at some point was assumed for all donors. PBMC were collected from donors and cultured in vitro with HA protein from Influena A virus (A/Beijing/32/92). T cell lines maintained for longer than 7 days were restimulated every 7 days with fresh PBMC and HA protein.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Human CD4+ T cell lines were generated against the hemagglutinin protein (HA) of influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92). The CD4+ T cell lines were derived from 18 different donors. Twelve donors had a history of recent (3-6 months) flu infection, and the other 6 had no history of influenza-like illness during the previous 4 years. All donors made a polyclonal response to HA, and a variety of MHC haplotypes were present within the group of 18 donors. The CD4+ T cell lines were stimulated with HA for 2-3 weeks and then used in a proliferation assay to screen a pool of 16-mer peptides (5 peptides) encompassing HA 1-35 for reactivity. T cells from 9 donors responded to the pool, but individual peptides from the pool were not tested to map fine specificity.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The HA 25-59 epitopic region was mapped with a pool of five 16-mer peptides encompassing this region, but no further fine epitope mapping was done. The HA 25-59 sequence corresponds to amino acids 41-75 of Genbank ID 49339231 for HA of Influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The HA 49-82 epitopic region was mapped with a pool of five 16-mer peptides encompassing this region, but no further fine epitope mapping was done. The sequence is said to be derived from Influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92(H3N2)) sequence but the sequence found in that strain database is GRICDSPHRILDGKNCTLIDALLGDPHCDGFQNK, where residue at position 81 is an N instead of a C. An internal source is provided to account for the difference in amino acid sequence between the reported epitope and the existing database sequences for HA protein.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The HA 317-348 epitopic region was mapped with a pool of five 16-mer peptides encompassing this region, but no further fine epitope mapping was done. Peptide sequence is for the HA protein of Influenza A/Hong Kong/90, but no Swiss-Prot ID is available for the HA protein of this influenza strain. Swiss Prot ID P12589 is for Influenza A/Memphis/6/86 (H3N2) and is identical to the Influenza A/Hong Kong/90 sequence.

T cell lines maintained for longer than 7 days were restimulated every 7 days with fresh PBMC and HA protein.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Human CD4+ T cell lines were generated against the hemagglutinin protein (HA) of influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92). The CD4+ T cell lines were derived from 18 different donors. Twelve donors had a history of recent (3-6 months) flu infection, and the other 6 had no history of influenza-like illness during the previous 4 years. All donors made a polyclonal response to HA, and a variety of MHC haplotypes were present within the group of 18 donors. The CD4+ T cell lines were stimulated with HA for 2-3 weeks and then used in a proliferation assay to screen a pool of 16-mer peptides (5 peptides) encompassing HA 384-418 for reactivity. T cells from 13 donors responded to the pool. T cells from one individual donor responded to 1 individual peptide within the pool (HA 388-403), but not to the other 4 peptides within the pool (HA 384-399, HA 393-408, HA 398-413 and HA 403-418).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The HA 407-442 epitopic region was mapped with a pool of five 16-mer peptides encompassing this region. Peptide sequence is for the HA protein of Influenza A/Hong Kong/90, but no Swiss-Prot ID is available for the HA protein of this influenza strain. Swiss Prot ID P12589 is for Influenza A/Memphis/6/86 (H3N2) and is identical to the Influenza A/Hong Kong/90 sequence.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Peptide sequence is for the HA protein of Influenza A/Hong Kong/90, but no Swiss-Prot ID is available for the HA protein of this influenza strain. Swiss Prot ID P12589 is for Influenza A/Memphis/6/86 (H3N2) and is identical to the Influenza A/Hong Kong/90 sequence.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Twelve donors had a history of recent (3-6 months) flu infection, and the other 6 had no history of influenza-like illness during the previous 4 years. However, natural infection at some point was assumed for all donors. PBMC were collected from donors and cultured in vitro with HA protein from Influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92). T cell lines maintained for longer than 7 days were restimulated every 7 days with fresh PBMC and HA protein.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The HA 20-40 sequence corresponds to amino acids 36-56 of Genbank ID 49339231 for HA of Influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92).

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Twelve donors had a history of recent (3-6 months) flu infection, and the other 6 had no history of influenza-like illness during the previous 4 years. However, natural infection at some point was assumed for all donors. PBMC were collected from donors and cultured in vitro with HA protein from Influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92). T cell lines maintained for longer than 7 days were restimulated every 7 days with fresh PBMC and HA protein.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Human CD4+ T cell lines from recently infected (within the prior 3-6 months) donors were generated against the hemagglutinin protein (HA) of influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/93). Two donors were screened for reactivity against the HA 20-40 region by pooling two overlapping peptides (HA 20-35 and HA 25-40). The response in both donors was shown to be HLA-DR-restricted by using anti-DR antibodies.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The HA 97-115 sequence corresponds to amino acids 113-131 of Genbank ID 49339231 for HA of Influenza A virus (A/Beijing/32/92).
